definition[0]: a process by which an organization makes a lot of big changes in a short time to improve its effectiveness
example[0]: a big shakeup of the education system
definition[1]: a process in which an organization makes lots of changes in a short time in order to become more successful, effective etc
example[1]: The shakeup could cost as many as 3,000 of the bankâ€™s 41,600 employees their jobs.
example[2]: High-levelmanagement shakeups were announced at two major Japanese brokerage firms.
